name: Top Scoring Players Analysis

0.content:
## NCAA Player Analysis

Normalized to points-per-game. Use the chart on the left to select a player. The right panels will update to show detailed seasonal performance, shot type distribution, shot efficiency, and other key stats for the selected player.
0.name: Introduction

1.content:
select
    player.full_name,
    # shot_type,
    total_points/game_count as points_per_game,
    coalesce(sum(points_scored),0) as total_points,
    --count(game.id) as game_count,
    --player_rank,
having
    player_rank<100
order by
    player_rank asc;
1.name: Top Scoring Players and Shot Types

2.content:
import std.display;

# where shot_display is not null
select
    --player_rank,
    sum(points_scored) as total_points,
    (count(id ? shot_made) / count(id))::float::percent as shot_percentage,
    --game.id,
    game.season,
having
    player_rank=1
;
2.name: Player Performance Over Season

3.content:
import std.display;

select  
    --player_rank,
    shot_display,
    sum(points_scored) as total_points  ,
    shooting_percentage,
    
having
    player_rank=1
order by  
    total_points desc  
limit 10;
3.name: Points Distribution by Shot Type

4.content:
import std.display;

select
--player_rank,
    shot_display,
    count(id) as shot_attempts,
    --shots_made,
    shooting_percentage
having
    player_rank = 1 and shot_display is not null
order by
    shot_attempts desc
limit 50;
4.name: Shot Efficiency Metrics

5.content:
import std.display;
 
select  
    --player_rank,
    shot_display,
    sub_shot_display,  
    shots_taken,  
    shots_made,  
    shooting_percentage,  
having
    player_rank = 1
order by shots_taken desc  
;
5.name: Shot Type and Subtype Details

8.content:
import std.display;

select  
    --player.full_name,
    --player_rank,
    min(game.season) as first_season,
    max(game.season)  as last_season,
    count(id ? type = 'threepointmade') as  three_points,
    count(id ? type = 'twopointmade') as two_points,
    count(id ? type = 'rebound') as rebounds 
having
    player_rank=1
limit 10;
8.name: Chart 8

9.content:
import std.display;

select  
    --player.full_name,
    --player_rank,
    type,
    count(id) as  event_count
    
having
    player_rank=1

limit 10;
9.name: Chart 9

10.content:
import std.display;

select  
    player.full_name,
    --player_rank
having
    player_rank=1
limit 10;
10.name: Chart 10

11.name: Chart 11

description: This dashboard enables exploration of the top scoring players, their shot types, and detailed performance metrics. Select a player on the left to drill down into their seasonal performance, shot distribution, and key statistics.
